intro: Impatiens hochstetteri subsp. angolensis, commonly known as the Angola impatiens, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant produces showy, bilaterally symmetric flowers with a distinctive, elongated spur at the base. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for cultivation in gardens and greenhouses.
